libMesh::Edge2类 参考

The Edge2 is an element in 1D composed of 2 nodes. 更多...

#include <edge_edge2.h>

类 libMesh::Edge2 继承关系图:
[图例]

Public 类型

enum  RefinementState {
  COARSEN = 0, DO_NOTHING, REFINE, JUST_REFINED,
  JUST_COARSENED, INACTIVE, COARSEN_INACTIVE, INVALID_REFINEMENTSTATE
}
 Enumeration of possible element refinement states. 更多...

详细描述

The Edge2 is an element in 1D composed of 2 nodes.

It is numbered like this:

*   EDGE2: o--------o        o---> xi
*          0        1
*

xi in [-1,1] is the reference element coordinate associated with the given numbering.

作者
Benjamin S. Kirk
日期
2002 A 1D geometric element with 2 nodes.

在文件 edge_edge2.h 第 46 行定义.

Elem subclasses which don't do their own bracketing node calculations will need to supply a static cache, since the default calculation is slow.

bool libMesh::Elem::active ( ) const
inlineinherited
返回
true if the element is active (i.e. has no active descendants) or AMR is disabled, false otherwise.
注解
It suffices to check the first child only.

void libMesh::Elem::active_family_tree ( std::vector< const Elem * > &  active_family,
bool  reset = true 
) const
inherited

Same as the family_tree() member, but only adds the active children.

Can be thought of as removing all the inactive elements from the vector created by family_tree, but is implemented more efficiently.

void libMesh::Elem::add_child ( Elem *  elem)
inherited

Adds a child pointer to the array of children of this element.

If this is the first child to be added, this method allocates memory in the parent's _children array, otherwise, it just sets the pointer.

在文件 elem.C 第 1666 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::_children, libMesh::Elem::n_children(), libMesh::Elem::parent(), libMesh::remote_elem , 以及 libMesh::Elem::set_child().

参考自 libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_first_order(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::copy_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::CheckpointIO::read_connectivity(), libMesh::CheckpointIO::read_remote_elem() , 以及 libMesh::Parallel::Packing< Elem * >::unpack().

1667 {
1668  const unsigned int nc = this->n_children();
1669 
1670  if (!_children)
1671  {
1672  _children = std::make_unique<Elem *[]>(nc);
1673 
1674  for (unsigned int c = 0; c != nc; c++)
1675  this->set_child(c, nullptr);
1676  }
1677 
1678  for (unsigned int c = 0; c != nc; c++)
1679  {
1680  if (this->_children[c] == nullptr || this->_children[c] == remote_elem)
1681  {
1682  libmesh_assert_equal_to (this, elem->parent());
1683  this->set_child(c, elem);
1684  return;
1685  }
1686  }
1687 
1688  libmesh_error_msg("Error: Tried to add a child to an element with full children array");
1689 }

void libMesh::DofObject::add_extra_integers ( const unsigned int  n_integers)
inherited

Assigns a set of extra integers to this DofObject.

There will now be n_integers associated; this replaces, not augments, any previous count.

Any newly-added values will initially be DofObject::invalid_id

If non-integer data is in the set, each datum of type T should be counted sizeof(T)/sizeof(dof_id_type) times in n_integers.

在文件 dof_object.C 第 490 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DofObject::_idx_buf, libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id , 以及 libMesh::DofObject::n_extra_integers().

参考自 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::add_elem(), libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_elem(), libMesh::DofObject::add_extra_integers(), libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::add_node(), libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_node(), libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::add_point(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_first_order(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::copy_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::create_submesh(), libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::insert_elem(), libMesh::DistributedMesh::insert_elem() , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::insert_node().

491 {
492  if (_idx_buf.empty())
493  {
494  if (n_integers)
495  {
496  _idx_buf.resize(n_integers+1, DofObject::invalid_id);
497  _idx_buf[0] = dof_id_type(-1);
498  }
499  return;
500  }
501  else
502  {
503  const int hdr = dof_id_signed_type(_idx_buf[0]);
504 
505  // We already have some extra integers, but may need more or
506  // less now.
507  if (hdr < 0)
508  {
509  const unsigned int old_n_integers = this->n_extra_integers();
510  if (n_integers != old_n_integers)
511  {
512  // Make or remove space as needed by count change
513  _idx_buf.resize(_idx_buf.size()+n_integers-old_n_integers, DofObject::invalid_id);
514 
515  // The start index for the extra integers is unchanged.
516  }
517  }
518  else if (n_integers)
519  // We had no extra integers, but need to add some
520  {
521  // Mark the DofObject as holding extra integers
522  _idx_buf[0] = dof_id_type(-hdr-1);
523 
524  // Insert the integer start position
525  DofObject::index_buffer_t::iterator it = _idx_buf.begin() + hdr;
526  _idx_buf.insert(it, _idx_buf.size()+1);
527 
528  // Increment the previous system start positions to account
529  // for the new header entry creating an offset
530  for (int i=1; i<hdr; i++)
531  _idx_buf[i]++;
532 
533  // Append space for extra integers
534  _idx_buf.resize(_idx_buf.size()+n_integers, DofObject::invalid_id);
535  }
536  }
537 }
libMesh::DofObject::n_extra_integers
unsigned int n_extra_integers() const
Returns how many extra integers are associated to the DofObject.

An invalid id to distinguish an uninitialized DofObject.

int8_t dof_id_signed_type
Definition: id_types.h:68
libMesh::DofObject::_idx_buf
index_buffer_t _idx_buf
Definition: dof_object.h:675
libMesh::dof_id_type
uint8_t dof_id_type
Definition: id_types.h:67
void libMesh::DofObject::add_extra_integers ( const unsigned int  n_integers,
const std::vector< dof_id_type > &  default_values 
)
inherited

Assigns a set of extra integers to this DofObject.

There will now be n_integers associated; this replaces, not augments, any previous count.

Any newly-added values will be copied from default_values.

If non-integer data is in the set, each datum of type T should be counted sizeof(T)/sizeof(dof_id_type) times in n_integers, and its data should be expressed in default_values as per memcpy.

在文件 dof_object.C 第 542 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DofObject::_idx_buf, libMesh::DofObject::add_extra_integers() , 以及 libMesh::DofObject::n_extra_integers().

544 {
545  libmesh_assert_equal_to(n_integers, default_values.size());
546 
547  const unsigned int n_old_integers = this->n_extra_integers();
548  this->add_extra_integers(n_integers);
549  if (n_integers > n_old_integers)
550  {
551  const unsigned int n_more_integers = n_integers - n_old_integers;
552  std::copy(default_values.begin()+n_old_integers,
553  default_values.end(),
554  _idx_buf.end()-n_more_integers);
555  }
556 }

void libMesh::DofObject::add_system ( )
inherited

Adds an additional system to the DofObject.

在文件 dof_object.C 第 195 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DofObject::_idx_buf, libMesh::DofObject::has_extra_integers(), libMesh::DofObject::n_systems(), libMesh::DofObject::n_var_groups(), libMesh::DofObject::n_vars() , 以及 libMesh::DofObject::set_n_systems().

196 {
197  // quick return?
198  if (this->n_systems() == 0)
199  {
200  this->set_n_systems(1);
201  return;
202  }
203 
204  // cache this value before we screw it up!
205  const unsigned int ns_orig = this->n_systems();
206 
207  DofObject::index_buffer_t::iterator it = _idx_buf.begin() + ns_orig;
208 
209  // Create the entry for the new system indicating 0 variables.
210  //
211  // increment the number of systems and the offsets for each of
212  // the systems including the new one we just added.
213  if (this->has_extra_integers())
214  {
215  // this inserts the extra_integers' start position as the start
216  // position for the new system. We'll increment all those
217  // counts in one sweep next, to account for header expansion.
218  _idx_buf.insert(it, *it);
219 
220  _idx_buf[0]--;
221  for (unsigned int i=1; i<ns_orig+2; i++)
222  {
223  libmesh_assert_less(i, _idx_buf.size());
224  _idx_buf[i]++;
225  }
226  }
227  else
228  {
229  // this inserts the current vector size at the position for the
230  // new system
231  _idx_buf.insert(it, cast_int<dof_id_type>(_idx_buf.size()));
232 
233  for (unsigned int i=0; i<ns_orig+1; i++)
234  {
235  libmesh_assert_less(i, _idx_buf.size());
236  _idx_buf[i]++;
237  }
238  }
239 
240  libmesh_assert_equal_to (this->n_systems(), (ns_orig+1));
241  libmesh_assert_equal_to (this->n_vars(ns_orig), 0);
242  libmesh_assert_equal_to (this->n_var_groups(ns_orig), 0);
243 }

bool libMesh::Elem::ancestor ( ) const
inherited
返回
true if the element is an ancestor (i.e. has an active child or ancestor child), false otherwise or when AMR is disabled.

1633 {
1634 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1635 
1636  // Use a fast, DistributedMesh-safe definition
1637  const bool is_ancestor =
1638  !this->active() && !this->subactive();
1639 
1640  // But check for inconsistencies if we have time
1641 #ifdef DEBUG
1642  if (!is_ancestor && this->has_children())
1643  {
1644  for (auto & c : this->child_ref_range())
1645  {
1646  if (&c != remote_elem)
1647  {
1648  libmesh_assert(!c.active());
1649  libmesh_assert(!c.ancestor());
1650  }
1651  }
1652  }
1653 #endif // DEBUG

1656

1658  return false;
1659 #endif

在文件 elem.C 第 2008 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::_get_parent_indices_cache(), libMesh::Elem::embedding_matrix(), libMesh::Elem::embedding_matrix_version(), libMesh::invalid_uint, libMesh::Elem::n_children(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes_in_child(), libMesh::parent_indices_mutex , 以及 libMesh::Real.

参考自 libMesh::MeshRefinement::add_node() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::parent_bracketing_nodes().

2010 {
2011  const unsigned int nc = this->n_children();
2012  libmesh_assert_less(child, nc);
2013 
2014  // Cached return values, indexed first by embedding_matrix version,
2015  // then by child number, then by child node number.
2016  std::vector<std::vector<std::vector<signed char>>> &
2017  cached_parent_indices = this->_get_parent_indices_cache();
2018 
2019  unsigned int em_vers = this->embedding_matrix_version();
2020 
2021  // We may be updating the cache on one thread, and while that
2022  // happens we can't safely access the cache from other threads.
2023  Threads::spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(parent_indices_mutex);
2024 
2025  if (em_vers >= cached_parent_indices.size())
2026  cached_parent_indices.resize(em_vers+1);
2027 
2028  if (child >= cached_parent_indices[em_vers].size())
2029  {
2030  const signed char nn = cast_int<signed char>(this->n_nodes());
2031 
2032  cached_parent_indices[em_vers].resize(nc);
2033 
2034  for (unsigned int c = 0; c != nc; ++c)
2035  {
2036  const unsigned int ncn = this->n_nodes_in_child(c);
2037  cached_parent_indices[em_vers][c].resize(ncn);
2038  for (unsigned int cn = 0; cn != ncn; ++cn)
2039  {
2040  for (signed char n = 0; n != nn; ++n)
2041  {
2042  const Real em_val = this->embedding_matrix
2043  (c, cn, n);
2044  if (em_val == 1)
2045  {
2046  cached_parent_indices[em_vers][c][cn] = n;
2047  break;
2048  }
2049 
2050  if (em_val != 0)
2051  {
2052  cached_parent_indices[em_vers][c][cn] =
2053  -1;
2054  break;
2055  }
2056 
2057  // We should never see an all-zero embedding matrix
2058  // row
2059  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (n+1, nn);
2060  }
2061  }
2062  }
2063  }
2064 
2065  const signed char cache_val =
2066  cached_parent_indices[em_vers][child][child_node];
2067  if (cache_val == -1)
2068  return libMesh::invalid_uint;
2069 
2070  return cached_parent_indices[em_vers][child][child_node];
2071 }

const std::vector< std::pair< dof_id_type, dof_id_type > > libMesh::Elem::bracketing_nodes ( unsigned int  c,
unsigned int  n 
) const
virtualinherited
返回
All the pairs of nodes (indexed by global node id) which should bracket node n of child c.

在文件 elem.C 第 2279 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::build(), libMesh::Elem::child_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::default_order(), libMesh::FIRST, libMesh::HEX20, libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::make_range(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes_in_child(), libMesh::Elem::node_id(), libMesh::Elem::parent_bracketing_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::second_order_equivalent_type() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::type().

参考自 libMesh::MeshRefinement::add_node() , 以及 libMesh::TopologyMap::fill().

2281 {
2282  std::vector<std::pair<dof_id_type, dof_id_type>> returnval;
2283 
2284  const std::vector<std::pair<unsigned char, unsigned char>> & pbc =
2285  this->parent_bracketing_nodes(child,child_node);
2286 
2287  for (const auto & pb : pbc)
2288  {
2289  const unsigned short n_n = this->n_nodes();
2290  if (pb.first < n_n && pb.second < n_n)
2291  returnval.emplace_back(this->node_id(pb.first), this->node_id(pb.second));
2292  else
2293  {
2294  // We must be on a non-full-order higher order element...
2295  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to(this->default_order(), FIRST);
2296  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to
2297  (second_order_equivalent_type (this->type(), true),
2298  this->type());
2299  libmesh_assert_equal_to
2300  (second_order_equivalent_type (this->type(), false),
2301  this->type());
2302 
2303  // And that's a shame, because this is a nasty search:
2304 
2305  // Build the full-order type
2306  ElemType full_type =
2307  second_order_equivalent_type(this->type(), /*full_ordered=*/ true);
2308  std::unique_ptr<Elem> full_elem = Elem::build(full_type);
2309 
2310  dof_id_type pt1 = DofObject::invalid_id;
2311  dof_id_type pt2 = DofObject::invalid_id;
2312 
2313  // Find the bracketing nodes by figuring out what
2314  // already-created children will have them.
2315 
2316  // This only doesn't break horribly because we add children
2317  // and nodes in straightforward + hierarchical orders...
2318  for (unsigned int c=0; c <= child; ++c)
2319  for (auto n : make_range(this->n_nodes_in_child(c)))
2320  {
2321  if (c == child && n == child_node)
2322  break;
2323 
2324  if (pb.first == full_elem->as_parent_node(c,n))
2325  {
2326  // We should be consistent
2327  if (pt1 != DofObject::invalid_id)
2328  libmesh_assert_equal_to(pt1, this->child_ptr(c)->node_id(n));
2329 
2330  pt1 = this->child_ptr(c)->node_id(n);
2331  }
2332 
2333  if (pb.second == full_elem->as_parent_node(c,n))
2334  {
2335  // We should be consistent
2336  if (pt2 != DofObject::invalid_id)
2337  libmesh_assert_equal_to(pt2, this->child_ptr(c)->node_id(n));
2338 
2339  pt2 = this->child_ptr(c)->node_id(n);
2340  }
2341  }
2342 
2343  // We should *usually* find all bracketing nodes by the time
2344  // we query them (again, because of the child & node add
2345  // order)
2346  //
2347  // The exception is if we're a HEX20, in which case we will
2348  // find pairs of vertex nodes and edge nodes bracketing the
2349  // new central node but we *won't* find the pairs of face
2350  // nodes which we would have had on a HEX27. In that case
2351  // we'll still have enough bracketing nodes for a
2352  // topological lookup, but we won't be able to make the
2353  // following assertions.
2354  if (this->type() != HEX20)
2355  {
2356  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (pt1, DofObject::invalid_id);
2357  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (pt2, DofObject::invalid_id);
2358  }
2359 
2360  if (pt1 != DofObject::invalid_id &&
2361  pt2 != DofObject::invalid_id)
2362  returnval.emplace_back(pt1, pt2);
2363  }
2364  }
2365 
2366  return returnval;
2367 }

std::unique_ptr< Elem > libMesh::Elem::build_with_id ( const ElemType  type,
dof_id_type  id 
)
staticinherited

Calls the build() method above with a nullptr parent, and additionally sets the newly-created Elem's id.

This can be useful when adding pre-numbered Elems to a Mesh via add_elem() calls.

在文件 elem.C 第 374 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::build().

参考自 libMesh::MeshTools::Subdivision::all_subdivision(), libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_cube(), libMesh::TetGenIO::element_in(), libMesh::Poly2TriTriangulator::insert_refinement_points(), libMesh::GmshIO::read_mesh(), libMesh::MatlabIO::read_stream() , 以及 libMesh::Poly2TriTriangulator::triangulate_current_points().

376 {
377  // Call the other build() method with nullptr parent, then set the
378  // required id.
379  auto temp = Elem::build(type, nullptr);
380  temp->set_id(id);
381  return temp;
382 }

unsigned int libMesh::Edge::center_node_on_side ( const unsigned short  side) const
finaloverridevirtualinherited
返回
The local index of the center node on the side side.

A center node is a node that is located at the centroid of the given side. If the given side does not have a center node, this will return invalid_uint.

重载 libMesh::Elem .

Definition: edge.h:74
Point libMesh::Elem::centroid ( ) const
virtualinherited

Calls Elem::vertex_average() for backwards compatibility.

This method has now been deprecated, so it will be removed at some point in the future. Calls to Elem::centroid() in user code should be updated to either call Elem::vertex_average() or Elem::true_centroid() on a case by case basis.

在文件 elem.C 第 393 行定义.

参考 libMesh::err , 以及 libMesh::Elem::vertex_average().

394 {
395  libmesh_do_once(libMesh::err
396  << "Elem::centroid() has been deprecated. Replace with either "
397  << "Elem::vertex_average() to maintain existing behavior, or "
398  << "the more expensive Elem::true_centroid() "
399  << "in cases where the true 'geometric' centroid is required."
400  << std::endl);
401  libmesh_deprecated();
402 
403  return Elem::vertex_average();
404 }

SimpleRange< Elem::ChildRefIter > libMesh::Elem::child_ref_range ( )
inlineinherited

Returns a range with all children of a parent element, usable in range-based for loops.

The exact type of the return value here may be subject to change in future libMesh releases, but the iterators will always dereference to produce a reference to a child element.

在文件 elem.h 第 2164 行定义.

void libMesh::Elem::coarsen ( )

Coarsen the element.

This function is non-virtual since it is the same for all element types.

在文件 elem_refinement.C 第 163 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::active(), libMesh::Elem::child_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::child_ref_range(), libMesh::Elem::COARSEN, libMesh::Elem::COARSEN_INACTIVE, libMesh::Elem::embedding_matrix(), libMesh::Elem::INACTIVE, libMesh::Elem::JUST_COARSENED, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::n_children(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::node_index_range(), libMesh::Elem::point(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::Elem::refinement_flag(), libMesh::remote_elem, libMesh::Elem::set_p_level() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::set_refinement_flag().

164 {
165  libmesh_assert_equal_to (this->refinement_flag(), Elem::COARSEN_INACTIVE);
166  libmesh_assert (!this->active());
167 
168  // We no longer delete children until MeshRefinement::contract()
169 
170  unsigned int parent_p_level = 0;
171 
172  const unsigned int n_n = this->n_nodes();
173 
174  // re-compute hanging node nodal locations
175  for (unsigned int c = 0, nc = this->n_children(); c != nc; ++c)
176  {
177  Elem * mychild = this->child_ptr(c);
178  if (mychild == remote_elem)
179  continue;
180  for (auto cnode : mychild->node_index_range())
181  {
182  Point new_pos;
183  bool calculated_new_pos = false;
184 
185  for (unsigned int n=0; n<n_n; n++)
186  {
187  // The value from the embedding matrix
188  const Real em_val = this->embedding_matrix(c,cnode,n);
189 
190  // The node location is somewhere between existing vertices
191  if ((em_val != 0.) && (em_val != 1.))
192  {
193  new_pos.add_scaled (this->point(n), em_val);
194  calculated_new_pos = true;
195  }
196  }
197 
198  if (calculated_new_pos)
199  {
200  //Move the existing node back into it's original location
201  for (unsigned int i=0; i<LIBMESH_DIM; i++)
202  {
203  Point & child_node = mychild->point(cnode);
204  child_node(i)=new_pos(i);
205  }
206  }
207  }
208  }
209 
210  for (auto & mychild : this->child_ref_range())
211  {
212  if (&mychild == remote_elem)
213  continue;
214  libmesh_assert_equal_to (mychild.refinement_flag(), Elem::COARSEN);
215  mychild.set_refinement_flag(Elem::INACTIVE);
216  if (mychild.p_level() > parent_p_level)
217  parent_p_level = mychild.p_level();
218  }
219 
220  this->set_refinement_flag(Elem::JUST_COARSENED);
221  this->set_p_level(parent_p_level);
222 
223  libmesh_assert (this->active());
224 }

108  libmesh_assert_less (sc, this->n_sub_elem());
109  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (iop, INVALID_IO_PACKAGE);
110 
111  // Create storage
112  conn.resize(2);
113 
114  switch (iop)
115  {
116  case TECPLOT:
117  {
118  conn[0] = this->node_id(0)+1;
119  conn[1] = this->node_id(1)+1;
120  return;
121  }
122 
123  case VTK:
124  {
125  conn[0] = this->node_id(0);
126  conn[1] = this->node_id(1);
127  return;
128  }

781  unsigned int num_contained_edges = 0;
782

787  {

libMesh::make_range
IntRange< T > make_range(T beg, T end)
The 2-parameter make_range() helper function returns an IntRange&lt;T&gt; when both input parameters are of...
Definition: int_range.h:134
libMesh::Elem::contains_point
virtual bool contains_point(const Point &p, Real tol=TOLERANCE) const
Definition: elem.C:2373
bool libMesh::Elem::contains_point ( const Point &  p,
Real  tol = TOLERANCE 
) const
virtualinherited
返回
true if the point p is contained in this element, false otherwise.

For linear elements, performs an initial tight bounding box check (as an optimization step) and (if that passes) then uses the user-defined tolerance "tol" in a call to inverse_map() to actually test if the point is in the element. For quadratic elements, the bounding box optimization is skipped, and only the inverse_map() steps are performed.

注解
This routine should not be used to determine if a point is merely "nearby" an element to within some tolerance. For that, use Elem::close_to_point() instead.

被 libMesh::NodeElem, libMesh::Tet4, libMesh::InfHex, libMesh::Tri3, libMesh::InfPrism , 以及 libMesh::InfQuad4 重载.

在文件 elem.C 第 2373 行定义.

参考 libMesh::err, libMesh::Elem::point_test() , 以及 libMesh::TOLERANCE.

参考自 libMesh::Elem::contains_edge_of(), libMesh::Elem::contains_vertex_of(), libMesh::Elem::find_edge_neighbors(), libMesh::Elem::find_point_neighbors(), libMesh::InfFE< friend_Dim, friend_T_radial, friend_T_map >::inf_compute_constraints(), libMesh::PointLocatorNanoflann::operator()(), libMesh::PointLocatorTree::operator()(), libMesh::System::point_gradient(), libMesh::System::point_hessian() , 以及 libMesh::System::point_value().

2374 {
2375  // We currently allow the user to enlarge the bounding box by
2376  // providing a tol > TOLERANCE (so this routine is identical to
2377  // Elem::close_to_point()), but print a warning so that the
2378  // user can eventually switch his code over to calling close_to_point()
2379  // instead, which is intended to be used for this purpose.
2380  if (tol > TOLERANCE)
2381  {
2382  libmesh_do_once(libMesh::err
2383  << "WARNING: Resizing bounding box to match user-specified tolerance!\n"
2384  << "In the future, calls to Elem::contains_point() with tol > TOLERANCE\n"
2385  << "will be more optimized, but should not be used\n"
2386  << "to search for points 'close to' elements!\n"
2387  << "Instead, use Elem::close_to_point() for this purpose.\n"
2388  << std::endl;);
2389  return this->point_test(p, tol, tol);
2390  }
2391  else
2392  return this->point_test(p, TOLERANCE, tol);
2393 }
libMesh::TOLERANCE
static constexpr Real TOLERANCE
Definition: libmesh_common.h:150
libMesh::Elem::point_test

Shared private implementation used by the contains_point() and close_to_point() routines.
Definition: elem.C:2410

bool libMesh::Elem::contains_vertex_of ( const Elem *  e,
bool  mesh_connection = false 
) const
inherited
返回
true if a vertex of e is contained in this element. If mesh_connection is true, looks specifically for containment possibilities of an element e that is connected to this via membership in the same manifold of the same mesh.

在文件 elem.C 第 741 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::contains_point(), libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::make_range(), libMesh::Elem::n_vertices(), libMesh::Elem::node_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::node_ref() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::point().

742 {
743  // Our vertices are the first numbered nodes
744  const unsigned int nv = e->n_vertices();
745  const unsigned int my_nv = this->n_vertices();
746 
747  // Check for vertex-to-vertex containment first; contains_point() is
748  // expensive
749  for (auto n : make_range(nv))
750  {
751  const Node * vertex = e->node_ptr(n);
752  for (auto my_n : make_range(my_nv))
753  if (&this->node_ref(my_n) == vertex)
754  return true;
755  }
756 
757  // If e is in our mesh, then we might be done testing
758  if (mesh_connection)
759  {
760  const unsigned int l = this->level();
761  const unsigned int el = e->level();
762 
763  if (l >= el)
764  return false;
765 
766  // We could also return false for l==el-1 iff we knew we had no
767  // triangular faces, but we don't have an API to check that.
768  }
769 
770  // Our vertices are the first numbered nodes
771  for (auto n : make_range(nv))
772  if (this->contains_point(e->point(n)))
773  return true;
774  return false;
775 }

void libMesh::Elem::contract ( )
inherited

Contract an active element, i.e.

remove pointers to any subactive children. This should only be called via MeshRefinement::contract, which will also remove subactive children from the mesh.

dof_id_type libMesh::DofObject::dof_number ( const unsigned int  s,
const unsigned int  var,
const unsigned int  comp 
) const
inlineinherited
返回
The global degree of freedom number for variable var, component comp for system s associated with this DofObject

When partitioning and DoF numbering have been performed by libMesh, every current DoF on this DofObject will belong to its processor.

返回
The global degree of freedom number for variable group vg, variable index vig within the group, component comp out of n_comp, for system s on this DofObject

1052  libmesh_assert_less (s, this->n_systems());
1053  libmesh_assert_less (vg, this->n_var_groups(s));
1054  libmesh_assert_less (vig, this->n_vars(s,vg));
1055 
1056  const unsigned int
1057  start_idx_sys = this->start_idx(s);
1058 
1059  libmesh_assert_less ((start_idx_sys + 2*vg + 1), _idx_buf.size());
1060 
1061  const dof_id_type
1062  base_idx = _idx_buf[start_idx_sys + 2*vg + 1];
1063 
1064  // if the first component is invalid, they
1065  // are all invalid
1066  if (base_idx == invalid_id)
1067  return invalid_id;
1068 
1069  // otherwise the index is the first component
1070  // index augmented by the component number
1071  else
1072  return cast_int<dof_id_type>(base_idx + vig*n_comp + comp);
1073 }

void libMesh::Elem::family_tree ( std::vector< const Elem * > &  family,
bool  reset = true 
) const
inherited

Fills the vector family with the children of this element, recursively.

Calling this method on a twice-refined element will give you the element itself, its direct children, and their children, etc... When the optional parameter reset is true, the vector will be cleared before the element and its descendants are added.

The family tree only includes ancestor and active elements. To include subactive elements as well, use total_family_tree().

在文件 elem.C 第 1723 行定义.

参考 libMesh::ElemInternal::family_tree().

1726  ElemInternal::family_tree(this, family, reset);
1727 }

void libMesh::Elem::find_edge_neighbors ( const Point &  p1,
const Point &  p2,
std::set< const Elem * > &  neighbor_set 
) const
inherited

This function finds all active elements in the same manifold as this element which touch the current active element along the whole edge defined by the two points p1 and p2.

在文件 elem.C 第 890 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::contains_point(), libMesh::Elem::find_point_neighbors() , 以及 libMesh::libmesh_assert().

参考自 libMesh::MeshRefinement::enforce_mismatch_limit_prior_to_refinement().

893 {
894  // Simple but perhaps suboptimal code: find elements containing the
895  // first point, then winnow this set down by removing elements which
896  // don't also contain the second point
897 
898  libmesh_assert(this->contains_point(p2));
899  this->find_point_neighbors(p1, neighbor_set);
900 
901  std::set<const Elem *>::iterator it = neighbor_set.begin();
902  const std::set<const Elem *>::iterator end = neighbor_set.end();
903 
904  while (it != end)
905  {
906  // As of C++11, set::erase returns an iterator to the element
907  // following the erased element, or end.
908  if (!(*it)->contains_point(p2))
909  it = neighbor_set.erase(it);
910  else
911  ++it;
912  }
913 }
libMesh::Elem::find_point_neighbors
void find_point_neighbors(const Point &p, std::set< const Elem * > &neighbor_set) const
This function finds all active elements (including this one) which are in the same manifold as this e...
Definition: elem.C:800
libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(ctx)
libMesh::Elem::contains_point
virtual bool contains_point(const Point &p, Real tol=TOLERANCE) const
Definition: elem.C:2373
void libMesh::Elem::find_edge_neighbors ( std::set< const Elem * > &  neighbor_set) const
inherited

This function finds all active elements in the same manifold as this element which touch the current active element along any edge (more precisely, at at least two points).

In this case, elements are included even if they do not touch a whole edge of this element.

在文件 elem.C 第 917 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::contains_edge_of() , 以及 libMesh::remote_elem.

918 {
919  neighbor_set.clear();
920  neighbor_set.insert(this);
921 
922  std::set<const Elem *> untested_set, next_untested_set;
923  untested_set.insert(this);
924 
925  while (!untested_set.empty())
926  {
927  // Loop over all the elements in the patch that haven't already
928  // been tested
929  for (const auto & elem : untested_set)
930  {
931  for (auto current_neighbor : elem->neighbor_ptr_range())
932  {
933  if (current_neighbor &&
934  current_neighbor != remote_elem) // we have a real neighbor on this side
935  {
936  if (current_neighbor->active()) // ... if it is active
937  {
938  if (this->contains_edge_of(current_neighbor) // ... and touches us
939  || current_neighbor->contains_edge_of(this))
940  {
941  // Make sure we'll test it
942  if (!neighbor_set.count(current_neighbor))
943  next_untested_set.insert (current_neighbor);
944 
945  // And add it
946  neighbor_set.insert (current_neighbor);
947  }
948  }
949 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
950  else // ... the neighbor is *not* active,
951  { // ... so add *all* neighboring
952  // active children
953  std::vector<const Elem *> active_neighbor_children;
954 
955  current_neighbor->active_family_tree_by_neighbor
956  (active_neighbor_children, elem);
957 
958  for (const auto & current_child : active_neighbor_children)
959  if (this->contains_edge_of(current_child) || current_child->contains_edge_of(this))
960  {
961  // Make sure we'll test it
962  if (!neighbor_set.count(current_child))
963  next_untested_set.insert (current_child);
964 
965  neighbor_set.insert (current_child);
966  }
967  }
968 #endif // #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
969  }
970  }
971  }
972  untested_set.swap(next_untested_set);
973  next_untested_set.clear();
974  }
975 }

bool contains_edge_of(const Elem *e) const

libMesh::ElemInternal::find_interior_neighbors
void find_interior_neighbors(T this_elem, std::set< T > &neighbor_set)
Definition: elem_internal.h:472
void libMesh::Elem::find_point_neighbors ( const Point &  p,
std::set< const Elem * > &  neighbor_set 
) const
inherited

This function finds all active elements (including this one) which are in the same manifold as this element and which touch the current active element at the specified point, which should be a point in the current element.

Elements which are not "in the same manifold" (e.g. the interior_parent of a boundary element) will not be found with this method.

Elements which overlap the specified point but which are only connected to the current element via elements which do not overlap that point (e.g. in a folded or tangled mesh) are not considered to "touch" the current element and will not be found with this method.

在文件 elem.C 第 800 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::active(), libMesh::Elem::contains_point(), libMesh::libmesh_assert() , 以及 libMesh::remote_elem.

参考自 libMesh::MeshRefinement::enforce_mismatch_limit_prior_to_refinement(), libMesh::Elem::find_edge_neighbors(), libMesh::MeshFunction::find_element(), libMesh::Elem::find_point_neighbors(), libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::get_boundary_points() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::is_semilocal().

802 {
803  libmesh_assert(this->contains_point(p));
804  libmesh_assert(this->active());
805 
806  neighbor_set.clear();
807  neighbor_set.insert(this);
808 
809  std::set<const Elem *> untested_set, next_untested_set;
810  untested_set.insert(this);
811 
812 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
813  std::vector<const Elem *> active_neighbor_children;
814 #endif // #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
815 
816  while (!untested_set.empty())
817  {
818  // Loop over all the elements in the patch that haven't already
819  // been tested
820  for (const auto & elem : untested_set)
821  for (auto current_neighbor : elem->neighbor_ptr_range())
822  {
823  if (current_neighbor &&
824  current_neighbor != remote_elem) // we have a real neighbor on this side
825  {
826  if (current_neighbor->active()) // ... if it is active
827  {
828  auto it = neighbor_set.lower_bound(current_neighbor);
829  if ((it == neighbor_set.end() || *it != current_neighbor) &&
830  current_neighbor->contains_point(p)) // ... don't have and touches p
831  {
832  // Add it and test it
833  next_untested_set.insert(current_neighbor);
834  neighbor_set.emplace_hint(it, current_neighbor);
835  }
836  }
837 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
838  else // ... the neighbor is *not* active,
839  { // ... so add *all* neighboring
840  // active children that touch p
841  active_neighbor_children.clear();
842  current_neighbor->active_family_tree_by_neighbor
843  (active_neighbor_children, elem);
844 
845  for (const auto & current_child : active_neighbor_children)
846  {
847  auto it = neighbor_set.lower_bound(current_child);
848  if ((it == neighbor_set.end() || *it != current_child) &&
849  current_child->contains_point(p))
850  {
851  // Add it and test it
852  next_untested_set.insert(current_child);
853  neighbor_set.emplace_hint(it, current_child);
854  }
855  }
856  }
857 #endif // #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
858  }
859  }
860  untested_set.swap(next_untested_set);
861  next_untested_set.clear();
862  }
863 }

ElemType libMesh::Elem::first_order_equivalent_type ( const ElemType  et)
staticinherited
返回
The element type of the associated first-order element, or INVALID_ELEM for first-order or other elements that cannot be converted into lower order equivalents.

For example, when this is a TET10, then TET4 is returned.

在文件 elem.C 第 2690 行定义.

参考 libMesh::EDGE2, libMesh::EDGE3, libMesh::EDGE4, libMesh::HEX20, libMesh::HEX27, libMesh::HEX8, libMesh::INFEDGE2, libMesh::INFHEX16, libMesh::INFHEX18, libMesh::INFHEX8, libMesh::INFPRISM12, libMesh::INFPRISM6, libMesh::INFQUAD4, libMesh::INFQUAD6, libMesh::INVALID_ELEM, libMesh::NODEELEM, libMesh::PRISM15, libMesh::PRISM18, libMesh::PRISM20, libMesh::PRISM21, libMesh::PRISM6, libMesh::PYRAMID13, libMesh::PYRAMID14, libMesh::PYRAMID18, libMesh::PYRAMID5, libMesh::QUAD4, libMesh::QUAD8, libMesh::QUAD9, libMesh::QUADSHELL4, libMesh::QUADSHELL8, libMesh::TET10, libMesh::TET14, libMesh::TET4, libMesh::TRI3, libMesh::TRI6, libMesh::TRI7 , 以及 libMesh::TRISHELL3.

void libMesh::Edge2::flip ( BoundaryInfo *  boundary_info)
finaloverridevirtual

Flips the element (by swapping node and neighbor pointers) to have a mapping Jacobian of opposite sign.

This is useful for automatically fixing up elements that have been newly created (e.g. from extrusions) with a negative Jacobian.

If boundary_info is not null, swap boundary side/edge ids consistently.

实现了 libMesh::Elem.

在文件 edge_edge2.C 第 157 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::swap2boundarysides(), libMesh::Elem::swap2neighbors() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::swap2nodes().

158 {
159  swap2nodes(0,1);
160  swap2neighbors(0,1);
161  swap2boundarysides(0,1,boundary_info);
162 }

inlineinherited

Gets the value on this object of the extra datum associated with index, which should have been obtained via a call to MeshBase::add_elem_datum or MeshBase::add_node_datum using the same type T.

1141 #ifndef NDEBUG
1142  const unsigned int n_more_integers = (sizeof(T)-1)/sizeof(dof_id_type);
1143 #endif
1144  libmesh_assert_less(index+n_more_integers, this->n_extra_integers());

DofObject* libMesh::DofObject::get_old_dof_object ( )
inlineinherited

Pointer accessor for previously public old_dof_object.

If you want to assert that the old_dof_object pointer is valid as well, consider using the get_old_dof_object_ref() accessor instead.

DofObject& libMesh::DofObject::get_old_dof_object_ref ( )
inlineinherited

As above, but do not use in situations where the old_dof_object may be nullptr, since this function asserts that the old_dof_object is valid before returning a reference to it.

void libMesh::Elem::hack_p_level_and_refinement_flag ( const unsigned int  p,
RefinementState  pflag 
)
inlineinherited

Sets the value of the p-refinement level for the element without altering the p-level of its ancestors; also sets the p_refinement_flag, simultaneously so that they can be safely checked for mutual consistency.

virtualinherited
返回
The maximum vertex separation for the element.

在文件 elem.C 第 531 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::n_vertices(), libMesh::Elem::point(), libMesh::Real , 以及 std::sqrt().

参考自 libMesh::DiscontinuityMeasure::boundary_side_integration(), libMesh::KellyErrorEstimator::boundary_side_integration(), libMesh::OldSolutionBase< Output, point_output >::check_old_context(), libMesh::Elem::get_info(), libMesh::LaplacianErrorEstimator::internal_side_integration(), libMesh::DiscontinuityMeasure::internal_side_integration(), libMesh::KellyErrorEstimator::internal_side_integration() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::point_test().

532 {
533  Real h_max=0;
534 
535  // Avoid calling a virtual a lot of times
536  const auto n_vertices = this->n_vertices();
537 
538  for (unsigned int n_outer=0; n_outer<n_vertices; n_outer++)
539  for (unsigned int n_inner=n_outer+1; n_inner<n_vertices; n_inner++)
540  {
541  const auto diff = (this->point(n_outer) - this->point(n_inner));
542 
543  h_max = std::max(h_max, diff.norm_sq());
544  }
545 
546  return std::sqrt(h_max);
547 }

void libMesh::ReferenceCounter::increment_constructor_count ( const std::string &  name)
inlineprotectednoexceptinherited

Increments the construction counter.

Should be called in the constructor of any derived class that will be reference counted.

在文件 reference_counter.h 第 183 行定义.

参考 libMesh::err, libMesh::BasicOStreamProxy< charT, traits >::get(), libMesh::Quality::name() , 以及 libMesh::Threads::spin_mtx.

参考自 libMesh::ReferenceCountedObject< RBParametrized >::ReferenceCountedObject().

184 {
185  libmesh_try
186  {
187  Threads::spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(Threads::spin_mtx);
188  std::pair<unsigned int, unsigned int> & p = _counts[name];
189  p.first++;
190  }
191  libmesh_catch (...)
192  {
193  auto stream = libMesh::err.get();
194  stream->exceptions(stream->goodbit); // stream must not throw
195  libMesh::err << "Encountered unrecoverable error while calling "
196  << "ReferenceCounter::increment_constructor_count() "
197  << "for a(n) " << name << " object." << std::endl;
198  std::terminate();
199  }
200 }

virtual bool libMesh::Edge2::infinite ( ) const
inlineoverridevirtual
返回
false. This is a finite element.

实现了 libMesh::Elem.

在文件 edge_edge2.h 第 154 行定义.

154 { return false; }
static constexpr bool libMesh::Elem::infinite ( )
inlinestaticinherited

在文件 elem.h 第 1747 行定义.

1747 { return false; }
const Elem * libMesh::Elem::interior_parent ( ) const
inherited
返回
The higher-dimensional Elem for which this Elem is a face.

In some cases it is desirable to extract the boundary (or a subset thereof) of a D-dimensional mesh as a (D-1)-dimensional manifold. In this case we may want to know the 'parent' element from which the manifold elements were extracted. We can easily do that for the level-0 manifold elements by storing the D-dimensional parent. This method provides access to that element.

This method returns nullptr if this->dim() == LIBMESH_DIM; in such cases no data storage for an interior parent pointer has been allocated.

在文件 elem.C 第 993 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::_elemlinks, libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::n_sides() , 以及 libMesh::remote_elem.

参考自 libMesh::FEMap::compute_face_map(), libMesh::connect_families(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::find_neighbors(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_side_and_node_maps(), libMesh::InfFE< friend_Dim, friend_T_radial, friend_T_map >::init_face_shape_functions(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_amr_interior_parents(), libMesh::Parallel::Packing< const Elem * >::pack(), libMesh::Elem::topologically_equal() , 以及 libMesh::Parallel::Packing< Elem * >::unpack().

994 {
995  // interior parents make no sense for full-dimensional elements.
996  if (this->dim() >= LIBMESH_DIM)
997  return nullptr;
998 
999  // they USED TO BE only good for level-0 elements, but we now
1000  // support keeping interior_parent() valid on refined boundary
1001  // elements.
1002  // if (this->level() != 0)
1003  // return this->parent()->interior_parent();
1004 
1005  // We store the interior_parent pointer after both the parent
1006  // neighbor and neighbor pointers
1007  Elem * interior_p = _elemlinks[1+this->n_sides()];
1008 
1009  // If we have an interior_parent, we USED TO assume it was a
1010  // one-higher-dimensional interior element, but we now allow e.g.
1011  // edge elements to have a 3D interior_parent with no
1012  // intermediate 2D element.
1013  // libmesh_assert (!interior_p ||
1014  // interior_p->dim() == (this->dim()+1));
1015  libmesh_assert (!interior_p ||
1016  (interior_p == remote_elem) ||
1017  (interior_p->dim() > this->dim()));
1018 
1019  // If an element in a multi-dimensional mesh has an interior_parent
1020  // link, it should be at our level or coarser, just like a neighbor
1021  // link. Our collect_families() code relies on this, but it might
1022  // be tempting for users to manually assign something that breaks
1023  // it.
1024  //
1025  // However, we *also* create temporary side elements, and we don't
1026  // bother with creating ancestors for those, so they can be at level
1027  // 0 even when they're sides of non-level-0 elements.
1028  libmesh_assert (!interior_p ||
1029  (interior_p->level() <= this->level()) ||
1030  (this->level() == 0 &&
1031  this->id() == DofObject::invalid_id));
1032 
1033  return interior_p;
1034 }
libMesh::Elem::_elemlinks
Elem ** _elemlinks
Pointers to this element&#39;s parent and neighbors, and for lower-dimensional elements&#39; interior_parent...

1041  if (this->dim() >= LIBMESH_DIM)
1042  return nullptr;

1045

1047  (interior_p == remote_elem) ||
1048  (interior_p->dim() > this->dim()));

749  // If the user does not specify the system number...
750  if (sys_num >= n_sys)
751  {
752  for (auto s : make_range(n_sys))
753  for (auto vg : make_range(this->n_var_groups(s)))

bool libMesh::Edge::is_flipped ( ) const
finaloverridevirtualinherited
返回
Whether the element is flipped compared to standard libMesh (e.g. clockwise for 2D elements) node orientations.

Always returns false if a 2D element is not in the XY plane or a 1D element is not on the X axis; user code designed to work for embedded manifolds should handle any consistent orientation, and determining whether an orientation is consistent is not a local operation.

实现了 libMesh::Elem.

true if the specified (local) node number is a "mid-edge" node on an infinite element edge.

libMesh::Edge2::num_nodes
static const int num_nodes
Geometric constants for Edge2.
Definition: edge_edge2.h:173
virtual bool libMesh::Elem::is_remote ( ) const
inlinevirtualinherited
返回
true if this element is remote, false otherwise.

A remote element (see RemoteElem) is a syntactic convenience – it is a placeholder for an element which exists on some other processor. Local elements are required to have valid neighbors, and these ghost elements may have remote neighbors for data structure consistency. The use of remote elements helps ensure that any element we may access has a nullptr neighbor only if it lies on the physical boundary of the domain.

被 libMesh::RemoteElem 重载.

在文件 elem.h 第 569 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::Elem::make_links_to_me_local().

570  { return false; }
bool libMesh::Elem::is_semilocal ( const processor_id_type  my_pid) const
inherited
返回
true if this element is "semilocal" to the calling processor, which must specify its rank.

This method is discouraged, as it uses the old definition of semilocal (elements which are not local but which are point neighbors of something local) rather than any of the new definitions discussed in ghosting_functor.h

unsigned int libMesh::Elem::level ( ) const
inlineinherited
返回
The refinement level of the current element.

If the element's parent is nullptr then by convention it is at level 0, otherwise it is simply at one level greater than its parent.

在文件 elem.h 第 2887 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::Elem::level() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::parent().

libMesh::MeshRefinement::make_coarsening_compatible(), libMesh::Elem::make_links_to_me_local(), libMesh::Elem::make_links_to_me_remote(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::make_refinement_compatible(), libMesh::Elem::nullify_neighbors(), libMesh::CompareElemIdsByLevel::operator()(), libMesh::Parallel::Packing< const Elem * >::pack(), libMesh::Parallel::Packing< const Elem * >::packable_size(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::remove_edge(), libMesh::Elem::remove_links_to_me(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::remove_shellface(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::remove_side(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::shellface_boundary_ids(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::side_with_boundary_id(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::sides_with_boundary_id(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::stitching_helper(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::test_level_one(), libMesh::Elem::top_parent(), libMesh::Elem::topological_neighbor(), libMesh::Parallel::Packing< Elem * >::unpack() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::which_neighbor_am_i().

2888 {
2889 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
2890 
2891  // if I don't have a parent I was
2892  // created directly from file
2893  // or by the user, so I am a
2894  // level-0 element
2895  if (this->parent() == nullptr)
2896  return 0;
2897 
2898  // if the parent and this element are of different
2899  // dimensionality we are at the same level as
2900  // the parent (e.g. we are the 2D side of a
2901  // 3D element)
2902  if (this->dim() != this->parent()->dim())
2903  return this->parent()->level();
2904 
2905  // otherwise we are at a level one
2906  // higher than our parent
2907  return (this->parent()->level() + 1);
2908 
2909 #else
2910 
2911  // Without AMR all elements are
2912  // at level 0.
2913  return 0;
2914 
2915 #endif
2916 }

void libMesh::Elem::libmesh_assert_valid_neighbors ( ) const
inherited

Checks for consistent neighbor links on this element.

在文件 elem.C 第 1189 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::n_neighbors(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::parent(), libMesh::remote_elem, libMesh::Elem::side_index_range(), libMesh::Elem::subactive() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::which_neighbor_am_i().

1190 {
1191  for (auto n : this->side_index_range())
1192  {
1193  const Elem * neigh = this->neighbor_ptr(n);
1194 
1195  // Any element might have a remote neighbor; checking
1196  // to make sure that's not inaccurate is tough.
1197  if (neigh == remote_elem)
1198  continue;
1199 
1200  if (neigh)
1201  {
1202  // Only subactive elements have subactive neighbors
1203  libmesh_assert (this->subactive() || !neigh->subactive());
1204 
1205  const Elem * elem = this;
1206 
1207  // If we're subactive but our neighbor isn't, its
1208  // return neighbor link will be to our first active
1209  // ancestor OR to our inactive ancestor of the same
1210  // level as neigh,
1211  if (this->subactive() && !neigh->subactive())
1212  {
1213  for (elem = this; !elem->active();
1214  elem = elem->parent())
1215  libmesh_assert(elem);
1216  }
1217  else
1218  {
1219  unsigned int rev = neigh->which_neighbor_am_i(elem);
1220  libmesh_assert_less (rev, neigh->n_neighbors());
1221 
1222  if (this->subactive() && !neigh->subactive())
1223  {
1224  while (neigh->neighbor_ptr(rev) != elem)
1225  {
1226  libmesh_assert(elem->parent());
1227  elem = elem->parent();
1228  }
1229  }
1230  else
1231  {
1232  const Elem * nn = neigh->neighbor_ptr(rev);
1233  libmesh_assert(nn);
1234 
1235  for (; elem != nn; elem = elem->parent())
1236  libmesh_assert(elem);
1237  }
1238  }
1239  }
1240  // If we don't have a neighbor and we're not subactive, our
1241  // ancestors shouldn't have any neighbors in this same
1242  // direction.
1243  else if (!this->subactive())
1244  {
1245  const Elem * my_parent = this->parent();
1246  if (my_parent &&
1247  // A parent with a different dimension isn't really one of
1248  // our ancestors, it means we're on a boundary mesh and this
1249  // is an interior mesh element for which we're on a side.
1250  // Nothing to test for in that case.
1251  (my_parent->dim() == this->dim()))
1252  libmesh_assert (!my_parent->neighbor_ptr(n));
1253  }
1254  }
1255 }

Throws an error.

Edge elems have n_edges() == 0, so it does not make sense to call local_edge_node().

Definition: edge.h:74
virtual unsigned int libMesh::Elem::local_singular_node ( const Point &  ,
const Real  = TOLERANCE*TOLERANCE 
) const
inlinevirtualinherited
返回
The local node index of the given point IF said node has a singular Jacobian for this element. If the given point is not a node or is a node and does not have a singular Jacobian, this will return invalid_uint.

The intention is for this to be overridden in derived element classes that do have nodes that have singular Jacobians. When mapping failures are caught, we can check this to see if the failed physical point is actually a singular point and return the correct master point.

被 libMesh::Pyramid 重载.

Definition: libmesh.h:254
BoundingBox libMesh::Elem::loose_bounding_box ( ) const
virtualinherited
返回
A bounding box (not necessarily the minimal bounding box) containing the geometric element.

The base class implementation determines a bounding box for the element nodes, which should be sufficient for first order finite elements. Higher order geometric elements will need to override with an implementation which takes curved elements into account.

被 libMesh::Tri6, libMesh::Tri7, libMesh::Quad9, libMesh::Hex8, libMesh::Quad8, libMesh::Prism6, libMesh::Tri3, libMesh::Pyramid5, libMesh::Edge3, libMesh::Quad4, libMesh::Edge4 , 以及 libMesh::Cell 重载.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::get_info(), libMesh::TreeNode< N >::insert(), libMesh::Quad4::loose_bounding_box(), libMesh::Pyramid5::loose_bounding_box(), libMesh::Tri3::loose_bounding_box(), libMesh::Prism6::loose_bounding_box() , 以及 libMesh::Hex8::loose_bounding_box().

2986 {
2987  Point pmin = this->point(0);
2988  Point pmax = pmin;
2989 
2990  unsigned int n_points = this->n_nodes();
2991  for (unsigned int p=0; p != n_points; ++p)
2992  for (unsigned d=0; d<LIBMESH_DIM; ++d)
2993  {
2994  const Point & pt = this->point(p);
2995  if (pmin(d) > pt(d))
2996  pmin(d) = pt(d);
2997 
2998  if (pmax(d) < pt(d))
2999  pmax(d) = pt(d);

const Point & point(const unsigned int i) const
Definition: elem.h:2253
void libMesh::Elem::make_links_to_me_local ( unsigned int  n,
unsigned int  neighbor_side 
)
inherited

Resets the neighbor_side pointers of our nth neighbor (and its descendants, if appropriate) to point to this Elem instead of to the global remote_elem.

Used by the library when a formerly remote element is being added to the local processor.

在文件 elem.C 第 1261 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::active(), libMesh::Elem::family_tree_by_side(), libMesh::Elem::has_children(), libMesh::Elem::is_remote(), libMesh::Elem::JUST_REFINED, libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::parent(), libMesh::Elem::refinement_flag(), libMesh::remote_elem , 以及 libMesh::Elem::subactive().

参考自 libMesh::Parallel::Packing< Elem * >::unpack().

1262 {
1263  Elem * neigh = this->neighbor_ptr(n);
1264 
1265  // Don't bother calling this function unless it's necessary
1266  libmesh_assert(neigh);
1267  libmesh_assert(!neigh->is_remote());
1268 
1269  // We never have neighbors more refined than us
1270  libmesh_assert_less_equal (neigh->level(), this->level());
1271 
1272  // We never have subactive neighbors of non subactive elements
1273  libmesh_assert(!neigh->subactive() || this->subactive());
1274 
1275  // If we have a neighbor less refined than us then it must not
1276  // have any more refined descendants we could have pointed to
1277  // instead.
1278  libmesh_assert((neigh->level() == this->level()) ||
1279  (neigh->active() && !this->subactive()) ||
1280  (!neigh->has_children() && this->subactive()));
1281 
1282  // If neigh is at our level, then its family might have
1283  // remote_elem neighbor links which need to point to us
1284  // instead, but if not, then we're done.
1285  if (neigh->level() != this->level())
1286  return;
1287 
1288  // What side of neigh are we on? nn.
1289  //
1290  // We can't use the usual Elem method because we're in the middle of
1291  // restoring topology. We can't compare side_ptr nodes because
1292  // users want to abuse neighbor_ptr to point to
1293  // not-technically-neighbors across mesh slits. We can't compare
1294  // node locations because users want to move those
1295  // not-technically-neighbors until they're
1296  // not-even-geometrically-neighbors.
1297 
1298  // Find any elements that ought to point to elem
1299  std::vector<Elem *> neigh_family;
1300 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1301  if (this->active())
1302  neigh->family_tree_by_side(neigh_family, nn);
1303  else
1304 #endif
1305  neigh_family.push_back(neigh);
1306 
1307  // And point them to elem
1308  for (auto & neigh_family_member : neigh_family)
1309  {
1310  // Only subactive elements point to other subactive elements
1311  if (this->subactive() && !neigh_family_member->subactive())
1312  continue;
1313 
1314  // Ideally, the neighbor link ought to either be correct
1315  // already or ought to be to remote_elem.
1316  //
1317  // However, if we're redistributing a newly created elem,
1318  // after an AMR step but before find_neighbors has fixed up
1319  // neighbor links, we might have an out of date neighbor
1320  // link to elem's parent instead.
1321 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1322  libmesh_assert((neigh_family_member->neighbor_ptr(nn) &&
1323  (neigh_family_member->neighbor_ptr(nn)->active() ||
1324  neigh_family_member->neighbor_ptr(nn)->is_ancestor_of(this))) ||
1325  (neigh_family_member->neighbor_ptr(nn) == remote_elem) ||
1326  ((this->refinement_flag() == JUST_REFINED) &&
1327  (this->parent() != nullptr) &&
1328  (neigh_family_member->neighbor_ptr(nn) == this->parent())));
1329 #else
1330  libmesh_assert((neigh_family_member->neighbor_ptr(nn) == this) ||
1331  (neigh_family_member->neighbor_ptr(nn) == remote_elem));
1332 #endif
1333 
1334  neigh_family_member->set_neighbor(nn, this);
1335  }
1336 }

void libMesh::Elem::make_links_to_me_remote ( )
inherited

Resets this element's neighbors' appropriate neighbor pointers and its parent's and children's appropriate pointers to point to the global remote_elem instead of this.

Used by the library before an element becomes remote on the local processor.

在文件 elem.C 第 1339 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::child_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::child_ref_range(), libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::Elem::has_children(), libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr_range(), libMesh::Elem::parent(), libMesh::remote_elem, libMesh::Elem::set_child(), libMesh::Elem::subactive() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::which_child_am_i().

参考自 libMesh::MeshCommunication::delete_remote_elements().

1340 {
1341  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (this, remote_elem);
1342 
1343  // We need to have handled any children first
1344 #if defined(LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR) && defined(DEBUG)
1345  if (this->has_children())
1346  for (auto & child : this->child_ref_range())
1347  libmesh_assert_equal_to (&child, remote_elem);
1348 #endif
1349 
1350  // Remotify any neighbor links
1351  for (auto neigh : this->neighbor_ptr_range())
1352  {
1353  if (neigh && neigh != remote_elem)
1354  {
1355  // My neighbor should never be more refined than me; my real
1356  // neighbor would have been its parent in that case.
1357  libmesh_assert_greater_equal (this->level(), neigh->level());
1358 
1359  if (this->level() == neigh->level() &&
1360  neigh->has_neighbor(this))
1361  {
1362 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1363  // My neighbor may have descendants which also consider me a
1364  // neighbor
1365  std::vector<Elem *> family;
1366  neigh->total_family_tree_by_neighbor (family, this);
1367 
1368  // FIXME - There's a lot of ugly const_casts here; we
1369  // may want to make remote_elem non-const
1370  for (auto & n : family)
1371  {
1372  libmesh_assert (n);
1373  if (n == remote_elem)
1374  continue;
1375  unsigned int my_s = n->which_neighbor_am_i(this);
1376  libmesh_assert_less (my_s, n->n_neighbors());
1377  libmesh_assert_equal_to (n->neighbor_ptr(my_s), this);
1378  n->set_neighbor(my_s, const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem));
1379  }
1380 #else
1381  unsigned int my_s = neigh->which_neighbor_am_i(this);
1382  libmesh_assert_less (my_s, neigh->n_neighbors());
1383  libmesh_assert_equal_to (neigh->neighbor_ptr(my_s), this);
1384  neigh->set_neighbor(my_s, const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem));
1385 #endif
1386  }
1387 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1388  // Even if my neighbor doesn't link back to me, it might
1389  // have subactive descendants which do
1390  else if (neigh->has_children())
1391  {
1392  // If my neighbor at the same level doesn't have me as a
1393  // neighbor, I must be subactive
1394  libmesh_assert(this->level() > neigh->level() ||
1395  this->subactive());
1396 
1397  // My neighbor must have some ancestor of mine as a
1398  // neighbor
1399  Elem * my_ancestor = this->parent();
1400  libmesh_assert(my_ancestor);
1401  while (!neigh->has_neighbor(my_ancestor))
1402  {
1403  my_ancestor = my_ancestor->parent();
1404  libmesh_assert(my_ancestor);
1405  }
1406 
1407  // My neighbor may have descendants which consider me a
1408  // neighbor
1409  std::vector<Elem *> family;
1410  neigh->total_family_tree_by_subneighbor (family, my_ancestor, this);
1411 
1412  for (auto & n : family)
1413  {
1414  libmesh_assert (n);
1415  if (n->is_remote())
1416  continue;
1417  unsigned int my_s = n->which_neighbor_am_i(this);
1418  libmesh_assert_less (my_s, n->n_neighbors());
1419  libmesh_assert_equal_to (n->neighbor_ptr(my_s), this);
1420  // TODO: we may want to make remote_elem non-const.
1421  n->set_neighbor(my_s, const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem));
1422  }
1423  }
1424 #endif
1425  }
1426  }
1427 
1428 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1429  // Remotify parent's child link
1430  Elem * my_parent = this->parent();
1431  if (my_parent &&
1432  // As long as it's not already remote
1433  my_parent != remote_elem &&
1434  // And it's a real parent, not an interior parent
1435  this->dim() == my_parent->dim())
1436  {
1437  unsigned int me = my_parent->which_child_am_i(this);
1438  libmesh_assert_equal_to (my_parent->child_ptr(me), this);
1439  my_parent->set_child(me, const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem));
1440  }
1441 #endif
1442 }

3060 {
3061  // This is undefined for subactive elements,
3062  // which have no active descendants
3063  libmesh_assert (!this->subactive());
3064  if (this->active())
3065  return this->p_level();
3066 
3067  unsigned int max_p_level = _p_level;
3068  for (auto & c : child_ref_range())
3069  max_p_level = std::max(max_p_level,
3070  c.max_descendant_p_level());

libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(ctx)
unsigned int libMesh::Elem::min_new_p_level_by_neighbor ( const Elem *  neighbor,
unsigned int  current_min 
) const
inherited
返回
The minimum new p-refinement level (i.e. after refinement and coarsening is done) of elements which are descended from this element and which share a side with the active neighbor.

在文件 elem.C 第 1974 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::active(), libMesh::Elem::child_ref_range(), libMesh::Elem::COARSEN, libMesh::Elem::has_neighbor(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::p_level(), libMesh::Elem::p_refinement_flag(), libMesh::Elem::REFINE, libMesh::remote_elem , 以及 libMesh::Elem::subactive().

1976 {
1977  libmesh_assert(!this->subactive());
1978  libmesh_assert(neighbor_in->active());
1979 
1980  // If we're an active element this is simple
1981  if (this->active())
1982  {
1983  unsigned int new_p_level = this->p_level();
1984  if (this->p_refinement_flag() == Elem::REFINE)
1985  new_p_level += 1;
1986  if (this->p_refinement_flag() == Elem::COARSEN)
1987  {
1988  libmesh_assert_greater (new_p_level, 0);
1989  new_p_level -= 1;
1990  }
1991  return std::min(current_min, new_p_level);
1992  }
1993 
1994  libmesh_assert(has_neighbor(neighbor_in));
1995 
1996  unsigned int min_p_level = current_min;
1997 
1998  for (auto & c : this->child_ref_range())
1999  if (&c != remote_elem && c.has_neighbor(neighbor_in))
2000  min_p_level =
2001  c.min_new_p_level_by_neighbor(neighbor_in, min_p_level);
2002 
2003  return min_p_level;
2004 }

unsigned int  current_min 
) const
inherited
返回
The minimum p-refinement level of elements which are descended from this element, and which share a side with the active neighbor.

在文件 elem.C 第 1945 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::active(), libMesh::Elem::child_ref_range(), libMesh::Elem::has_neighbor(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::p_level(), libMesh::remote_elem , 以及 libMesh::Elem::subactive().

参考自 libMesh::FEGenericBase< T >::compute_periodic_constraints() , 以及 libMesh::FEGenericBase< T >::compute_proj_constraints().

1947 {
1948  libmesh_assert(!this->subactive());
1949  libmesh_assert(neighbor_in->active());
1950 
1951  // If we're an active element this is simple
1952  if (this->active())
1953  return std::min(current_min, this->p_level());
1954 
1955  libmesh_assert(has_neighbor(neighbor_in));
1956 
1957  // The p_level() of an ancestor element is already the minimum
1958  // p_level() of its children - so if that's high enough, we don't
1959  // need to examine any children.
1960  if (current_min <= this->p_level())
1961  return current_min;
1962 
1963  unsigned int min_p_level = current_min;
1964 
1965  for (auto & c : this->child_ref_range())
1966  if (&c != remote_elem && c.has_neighbor(neighbor_in))
1967  min_p_level =
1968  c.min_p_level_by_neighbor(neighbor_in, min_p_level);
1969 
1970  return min_p_level;
1971 }

unsigned int libMesh::DofObject::n_comp ( const unsigned int  s,
const unsigned int  var 
) const
inlineinherited
返回
The number of components for variable var of system s associated with this DofObject. For example, the HIERARCHIC shape functions may have multiple DoFs associated with one node. Another example is the MONOMIALs, where only the elements hold the DoFs. For the different spatial directions, and orders, see FE.

返回
The number of components for VariableGroup vg of system s associated with this DofObject. For example, the HIERARCHIC shape functions may have multiple DoFs associated with one node. Another example is the MONOMIALs, where only the elements hold the DoFs. For the different spatial directions, and orders, see FE.

803 {
804  libmesh_assert_less (s, this->n_systems());
805 
806  unsigned int num = 0;
807 
808  // Count all variables
809  if (var == libMesh::invalid_uint)
810  for (auto v : make_range(this->n_vars(s)))
811  num += this->n_comp(s,v);
812 
813  // Only count specified variable
814  else
815  num = this->n_comp(s,var);
816 
817  return num;

unsigned int libMesh::DofObject::n_extra_integers ( ) const
inlineinherited

Returns how many extra integers are associated to the DofObject.

If non-integer data has been associated, each datum of type T counts for sizeof(T)/sizeof(dof_id_type) times in the return value.

89 { return 0; }
unsigned int libMesh::Elem::n_neighbors ( ) const
inlineinherited
返回
The number of neighbors the element that has been derived from this class has.

Only face (or edge in 2D) neighbors are stored, so this method returns n_sides(). At one point we intended to allow derived classes to override this, but too much current libMesh code assumes n_neighbors==n_sides.

在文件 elem.h 第 663 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::n_sides().

virtual unsigned int libMesh::Edge::n_permutations ( ) const
inlinefinaloverridevirtualinherited

Returns the number of independent permutations of element nodes - e.g.

a cube can be reoriented to put side 0 where side N is (for 0 <= N < 6) and then rotated in one of four ways, giving 24 possible permutations.

Permutations which change the mapping Jacobian of an element (i.e. flipping the element) are not allowed in this definition.

实现了 libMesh::Elem.

在文件 edge.h 第 201 行定义.

unsigned int libMesh::Elem::n_second_order_adjacent_vertices ( const unsigned int  n) const
virtualinherited
返回
The number of adjacent vertices that uniquely define the location of the second-order node, or 0 for linear elements.

This method is useful when converting linear elements to quadratic elements.

注解
n has to be greater than or equal to this->n_vertices().

libMesh::DofObject::end_idx

实现了 libMesh::Elem.

在文件 edge.h 第 79 行定义.

79 { return 2; }
const Elem * libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr ( unsigned int  i) const
inlineinherited
返回
A const pointer to the neighbor of this element, or nullptr if MeshBase::find_neighbors() has not been called.
注解
If MeshBase::find_neighbors() has been called and this function still returns nullptr, then the side is on a boundary of the domain.

SimpleRange< Elem::NeighborPtrIter > libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr_range ( )
inlineinherited

Returns a range with all neighbors of an element, usable in range-based for loops.

The exact type of the return value here may be subject to change in future libMesh releases, but the iterators will always dereference to produce a pointer to a neighbor element (or a null pointer, for sides which have no neighbors).

void libMesh::Elem::nullify_neighbors ( )
inherited

Replaces this element with nullptr for all of its neighbors.

This is useful when deleting an element.

在文件 elem.C 第 2638 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::Elem::n_neighbors(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr(), libMesh::remote_elem, libMesh::Elem::set_neighbor(), libMesh::Elem::side_index_range() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::which_neighbor_am_i().

2639 {
2640  // Tell any of my neighbors about my death...
2641  // Looks strange, huh?
2642  for (auto n : this->side_index_range())
2643  {
2644  Elem * current_neighbor = this->neighbor_ptr(n);
2645  if (current_neighbor && current_neighbor != remote_elem)
2646  {
2647  // Note: it is possible that I see the neighbor
2648  // (which is coarser than me)
2649  // but they don't see me, so avoid that case.
2650  if (current_neighbor->level() == this->level())
2651  {
2652  const unsigned int w_n_a_i = current_neighbor->which_neighbor_am_i(this);
2653  libmesh_assert_less (w_n_a_i, current_neighbor->n_neighbors());
2654  current_neighbor->set_neighbor(w_n_a_i, nullptr);
2655  this->set_neighbor(n, nullptr);
2656  }
2657  }
2658  }
2659 }

bool libMesh::Elem::operator== ( const Elem &  rhs) const
inherited
返回
true if two elements are equivalent, false otherwise. This is true if the elements are connected to identical global nodes, regardless of how those nodes might be numbered local to the elements.

在文件 elem.C 第 580 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::node_id() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::type().

581 {
582  // If the elements aren't the same type, they aren't equal
583  if (this->type() != rhs.type())
584  return false;
585 
586  const unsigned short n_n = this->n_nodes();
587  libmesh_assert_equal_to(n_n, rhs.n_nodes());
588 
589  // Make two sorted arrays of global node ids and compare them for
590  // equality.
591  std::array<dof_id_type, Elem::max_n_nodes> this_ids, rhs_ids;
592 
593  for (unsigned short n = 0; n != n_n; n++)
594  {
595  this_ids[n] = this->node_id(n);
596  rhs_ids[n] = rhs.node_id(n);
597  }
598 
599  // Sort the vectors to rule out different local node numberings.
600  std::sort(this_ids.begin(), this_ids.begin()+n_n);
601  std::sort(rhs_ids.begin(), rhs_ids.begin()+n_n);
602 
603  // If the node ids match, the elements are equal!
604  for (unsigned short n = 0; n != n_n; ++n)
605  if (this_ids[n] != rhs_ids[n])
606  return false;
607  return true;
608 }

void libMesh::Elem::orient ( BoundaryInfo *  boundary_info)
inlineinherited

Flips the element (by swapping node and neighbor pointers) to have a mapping Jacobian of opposite sign, iff we find a negative orientation.

This only fixes flipped elements; for tangled elements the only fixes possible are non-local.

在文件 elem.h 第 3099 行定义.

virtual Point libMesh::Elem::origin ( ) const
inlinevirtualinherited
返回
The origin for an infinite element.

Currently, all infinite elements used in a mesh share the same origin. Override this in infinite element classes.

const std::vector< std::pair< unsigned char, unsigned char > > & libMesh::Elem::parent_bracketing_nodes ( unsigned int  c,
unsigned int  n 
) const
virtualinherited
返回
All the pairs of nodes (indexed by local node id) which should bracket node n of child c.

被 libMesh::Prism21, libMesh::Prism20, libMesh::Tet14 , 以及 libMesh::Tri7 重载.

在文件 elem.C 第 2076 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::_get_bracketing_node_cache(), libMesh::TypeVector< T >::absolute_fuzzy_equals(), libMesh::Elem::as_parent_node(), libMesh::Elem::build(), libMesh::Elem::default_order(), libMesh::Elem::embedding_matrix(), libMesh::Elem::embedding_matrix_version(), libMesh::FIRST, libMesh::invalid_uint, libMesh::Elem::is_mid_infinite_edge_node(), libMesh::Elem::is_vertex_on_child(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::master_point(), libMesh::Elem::n_children(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes_in_child(), libMesh::parent_bracketing_nodes_mutex, libMesh::Real, libMesh::Elem::second_order_equivalent_type() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::type().

参考自 libMesh::Elem::bracketing_nodes().

2078 {
2079  // Indexed first by embedding matrix type, then by child id, then by
2080  // child node, then by bracketing pair
2081  std::vector<std::vector<std::vector<std::vector<std::pair<unsigned char, unsigned char>>>>> &
2082  cached_bracketing_nodes = this->_get_bracketing_node_cache();
2083 
2084  const unsigned int em_vers = this->embedding_matrix_version();
2085 
2086  // We may be updating the cache on one thread, and while that
2087  // happens we can't safely access the cache from other threads.
2088  Threads::spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(parent_bracketing_nodes_mutex);
2089 
2090  if (cached_bracketing_nodes.size() <= em_vers)
2091  cached_bracketing_nodes.resize(em_vers+1);
2092 
2093  const unsigned int nc = this->n_children();
2094 
2095  // If we haven't cached the bracketing nodes corresponding to this
2096  // embedding matrix yet, let's do so now.
2097  if (cached_bracketing_nodes[em_vers].size() < nc)
2098  {
2099  // If we're a second-order element but we're not a full-order
2100  // element, then some of our bracketing nodes may not exist
2101  // except on the equivalent full-order element. Let's build an
2102  // equivalent full-order element and make a copy of its cache to
2103  // use.
2104  if (this->default_order() != FIRST &&
2105  second_order_equivalent_type(this->type(), /*full_ordered=*/ true) != this->type())
2106  {
2107  // Check that we really are the non-full-order type
2108  libmesh_assert_equal_to
2109  (second_order_equivalent_type (this->type(), false),
2110  this->type());
2111 
2112  // Build the full-order type
2113  ElemType full_type =
2114  second_order_equivalent_type(this->type(), /*full_ordered=*/ true);
2115  std::unique_ptr<Elem> full_elem = Elem::build(full_type);
2116 
2117  // This won't work for elements with multiple
2118  // embedding_matrix versions, but every such element is full
2119  // order anyways.
2120  libmesh_assert_equal_to(em_vers, 0);
2121 
2122  // Make sure its cache has been built. We temporarily
2123  // release our mutex lock so that the inner call can
2124  // re-acquire it.
2125  lock.release();
2126  full_elem->parent_bracketing_nodes(0,0);
2127 
2128  // And then we need to lock again, so that if someone *else*
2129  // grabbed our lock before we did we don't risk accessing
2130  // cached_bracketing_nodes while they're working on it.
2131  // Threading is hard.
2132  lock.acquire(parent_bracketing_nodes_mutex);
2133 
2134  // Copy its cache
2135  cached_bracketing_nodes =
2136  full_elem->_get_bracketing_node_cache();
2137 
2138  // Now we don't need to build the cache ourselves.
2139  return cached_bracketing_nodes[em_vers][child][child_node];
2140  }
2141 
2142  cached_bracketing_nodes[em_vers].resize(nc);
2143 
2144  const unsigned int nn = this->n_nodes();
2145 
2146  // We have to examine each child
2147  for (unsigned int c = 0; c != nc; ++c)
2148  {
2149  const unsigned int ncn = this->n_nodes_in_child(c);
2150 
2151  cached_bracketing_nodes[em_vers][c].resize(ncn);
2152 
2153  // We have to examine each node in that child
2154  for (unsigned int n = 0; n != ncn; ++n)
2155  {
2156  // If this child node isn't a vertex or an infinite
2157  // child element's mid-infinite-edge node, then we need
2158  // to find bracketing nodes on the child.
2159  if (!this->is_vertex_on_child(c, n)
2160 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_INFINITE_ELEMENTS
2161  && !this->is_mid_infinite_edge_node(n)
2162 #endif
2163  )
2164  {
2165  // Use the embedding matrix to find the child node
2166  // location in parent master element space
2167  Point bracketed_pt;
2168 
2169  for (unsigned int pn = 0; pn != nn; ++pn)
2170  {
2171  const Real em_val =
2172  this->embedding_matrix(c,n,pn);
2173 
2174  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (em_val, 1);
2175  if (em_val != 0.)
2176  bracketed_pt.add_scaled(this->master_point(pn), em_val);
2177  }
2178 
2179  // Check each pair of nodes on the child which are
2180  // also both parent nodes
2181  for (unsigned int n1 = 0; n1 != ncn; ++n1)
2182  {
2183  if (n1 == n)
2184  continue;
2185 
2186  unsigned int parent_n1 =
2187  this->as_parent_node(c,n1);
2188 
2189  if (parent_n1 == libMesh::invalid_uint)
2190  continue;
2191 
2192  Point p1 = this->master_point(parent_n1);
2193 
2194  for (unsigned int n2 = n1+1; n2 < nn; ++n2)
2195  {
2196  if (n2 == n)
2197  continue;
2198 
2199  unsigned int parent_n2 =
2200  this->as_parent_node(c,n2);
2201 
2202  if (parent_n2 == libMesh::invalid_uint)
2203  continue;
2204 
2205  Point p2 = this->master_point(parent_n2);
2206 
2207  Point pmid = (p1 + p2)/2;
2208 
2209  if (pmid == bracketed_pt)
2210  {
2211  cached_bracketing_nodes[em_vers][c][n].emplace_back(parent_n1, parent_n2);
2212  break;
2213  }
2214  else
2215  libmesh_assert(!pmid.absolute_fuzzy_equals(bracketed_pt));
2216  }
2217  }
2218  }
2219  // If this child node is a parent node, we need to
2220  // find bracketing nodes on the parent.
2221  else
2222  {
2223  unsigned int parent_node = this->as_parent_node(c,n);
2224 
2225  Point bracketed_pt;
2226 
2227  // If we're not a parent node, use the embedding
2228  // matrix to find the child node location in parent
2229  // master element space
2230  if (parent_node == libMesh::invalid_uint)
2231  {
2232  for (unsigned int pn = 0; pn != nn; ++pn)
2233  {
2234  const Real em_val =
2235  this->embedding_matrix(c,n,pn);
2236 
2237  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (em_val, 1);
2238  if (em_val != 0.)
2239  bracketed_pt.add_scaled(this->master_point(pn), em_val);
2240  }
2241  }
2242  // If we're a parent node then we need no arithmetic
2243  else
2244  bracketed_pt = this->master_point(parent_node);
2245 
2246  for (unsigned int n1 = 0; n1 != nn; ++n1)
2247  {
2248  if (n1 == parent_node)
2249  continue;
2250 
2251  Point p1 = this->master_point(n1);
2252 
2253  for (unsigned int n2 = n1+1; n2 < nn; ++n2)
2254  {
2255  if (n2 == parent_node)
2256  continue;
2257 
2258  Point pmid = (p1 + this->master_point(n2))/2;
2259 
2260  if (pmid == bracketed_pt)
2261  {
2262  cached_bracketing_nodes[em_vers][c][n].emplace_back(n1, n2);
2263  break;
2264  }
2265  else
2266  libmesh_assert(!pmid.absolute_fuzzy_equals(bracketed_pt));
2267  }
2268  }
2269  }
2270  }
2271  }
2272  }
2273 
2274  return cached_bracketing_nodes[em_vers][child][child_node];
2275 }

virtual void libMesh::Edge::permute ( unsigned  perm_num)
inlinefinaloverridevirtualinherited

Permutes the element (by swapping node and neighbor pointers) according to the specified index.

This is useful for regression testing, by making it easy to make a structured mesh behave more like an arbitrarily unstructured mesh.

This is so far only used for regression testing, so we do not currently provide a way to permute any boundary side/edge ids along with the element permutation.

实现了 libMesh::Elem.

processor_id_type libMesh::DofObject::processor_id ( ) const
inlineinherited
返回
The processor that this DofObject belongs to.

When partitioning and DoF numbering have been performed by libMesh, every current DoF on this DofObject will belong to its processor.

virtual std::pair<Real,Real> libMesh::Elem::qual_bounds ( const ElemQuality  ) const
inlinevirtualinherited
返回
The suggested quality bounds for the Elem based on quality measure q.

These are the values suggested by the CUBIT User's Manual. Since this function can have no possible meaning for an abstract Elem, it is an error in the base class.

被 libMesh::InfQuad, libMesh::InfHex, libMesh::Quad, libMesh::Tri, libMesh::Hex , 以及 libMesh::Tet 重载.

在文件 elem.h 第 999 行定义.

1000  { libmesh_not_implemented(); return std::make_pair(0.,0.); }
Real libMesh::Elem::quality ( const ElemQuality  q) const
virtualinherited
返回
A quantitative assessment of element quality based on the quality metric q specified by the user.

I don't know what to do for any other metric in general; subclasses may have specific overrides.

被 libMesh::InfQuad, libMesh::InfHex, libMesh::Quad, libMesh::Tri, libMesh::Hex , 以及 libMesh::Tet 重载.

在文件 elem.C 第 1580 行定义.

参考 libMesh::ASPECT_RATIO, libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::Utility::enum_to_string(), libMesh::err, libMesh::Elem::local_edge_node(), libMesh::make_range(), libMesh::Elem::n_edges(), std::norm(), libMesh::Elem::point(), libMesh::Real , 以及 libMesh::Elem::type().

参考自 libMesh::Tet::quality(), libMesh::Hex::quality(), libMesh::Tri::quality(), libMesh::Quad::quality(), libMesh::InfHex::quality() , 以及 libMesh::InfQuad::quality().

1581 {
1582  switch (q)
1583  {
1584  // Aspect Ratio: Maximum edge length ratios
1585  case ASPECT_RATIO:
1586  {
1587  if (this->dim() < 2)
1588  return 1;
1589 
1590  std::vector<Real> edge_lengths;
1591  for (auto e : make_range(this->n_edges()))
1592  {
1593  const Point p0 = this->point(this->local_edge_node(e,0)),
1594  p1 = this->point(this->local_edge_node(e,1));
1595 
1596  edge_lengths.push_back((p1-p0).norm());
1597  }
1598 
1599  const Real max = *std::max_element(edge_lengths.begin(),
1600  edge_lengths.end()),
1601  min = *std::min_element(edge_lengths.begin(),
1602  edge_lengths.end());
1603 
1604  if (min == 0.)
1605  return 0.;
1606  else
1607  return max / min;
1608  }
1613  default:
1614  {
1615  libmesh_do_once( libmesh_here();
1616 
1617  libMesh::err << "ERROR: quality metric "
1618  << Utility::enum_to_string(q)
1619  << " not implemented on element type "
1620  << Utility::enum_to_string(this->type())
1621  << std::endl
1622  << "Returning 1."
1623  << std::endl; );
1624 
1625  return 1.;
1626  }
1627  }
1628 }
